p: Up to the I World War, quinine was the only drug used to treat malaria. The difficulty to obtain the bark of Cinchona motivated the Germans to develop, in 1920, a synthetic molecule, 9-aminoacridine, that has been marketed since 1930 by the trade name Atabrine (Wallace 1989). Despite the advances, the countries involved in the I World War reported large decrease in their populations due to malaria.
